package.name: csv-vim
package.title: Vim plugin csv.vim
package.description: used for handling comma separated data

package.name: tern-for-vim
package.title: Vim plugin for Tern
package.description: WARNING: please configure the proxy settings for the Administrator in Node.js npm before installing this package. Provides [Tern](http://ternjs.net/)-based JavaScript editing support

package.name: vim-airline
package.title: Vim plugin Airline
package.description: Lean & mean status/tabline

package.name: vim-bufferline
package.title: Vim plugin Bufferline
package.description: Super simple vim plugin to show the list of buffers in the command bar.

package.name: vim-buftabline
package.title: Vim plugin vim-buftabline
package.description: Vim Plugin. It takes over the tabline and renders the buffer list in it instead of a tab list

package.name: vim-colorschemes
package.title: Vim plugin Colorschemes
package.description: set of colorschemes

package.name: vim-ctrlp
package.title: Vim plugin CtrlP
package.description: Full path fuzzy file, buffer, mru, tag, ... finder

package.name: vim-delphi
package.title: Vim plugin Delphi 7-2010 syntax
package.description: Syntax highlighting for Delphi 7-2010

package.name: vim-easymotion
package.title: Vim plugin EasyMotion
package.description: Vim Plugin. Provides a much simpler way to use some motions. When one of the available motions is triggered, all visible text preceding or following the cursor is faded, and motion targets are highlighted.

package.name: vim-fuzzyfinder
package.title: Vim plugin FuzzyFinder
package.description: provides convenient ways to quickly reach the buffer/file/command/bookmark/tag you want. FuzzyFinder searches with the fuzzy/partial pattern to which it converted an entered pattern.

package.name: vim-gcw-syntax
package.title: Vim plugin vimgcwsyntax
package.description: Google Code Wiki Syntax support To enable it, add to your C:\Users\username\\.vimrc the following: autocmd BufNewFile,BufRead *.wiki set ft=googlecodewiki

package.name: vim-go
package.title: Vim plugin for Go
package.description: Go (golang) support for Vim. Contains official misc/vim files. vim-go installs automatically all necessary binaries for providing seamless Vim integration. It comes with pre-defined sensible settings (like auto gofmt on save), has autocomplete, snippet support, improved syntax highlighting, go toolchain commands, etc... It's highly customizable and each individual feature can be disabled/enabled easily.

package.name: vim-l9
package.title: Vim plugin L9
package.description: Vim-script library, which provides some utility functions and commands for programming in Vim.

package.name: vim-minibufexplorer
package.title: Vim plugin MiniBufExplorer
package.description: Vim Plugin. Shows buffers as tabs along the top or bottom of your screen.

package.name: vim-neomru
package.title: Vim plugin neomru.vim
package.description: browse the list of most recently used (MRU) files via Unite

package.name: vim-nerdtree
package.title: Vim plugin NERD Tree
package.description: allows you to explore your filesystem and to open files and directories. It presents the filesystem to you in the form of a tree which you manipulate with the keyboard and/or mouse. It also allows you to perform simple filesystem operations.

package.name: vim-pathogen
package.title: Vim plugin Pathogen
package.description:
Manages 'runtimepath'
Every Vim plugin including pathogen creates a directory link from %ALLUSERSPROFILE%/Npackd/VimPlugins/plugin-name to the plugin installation directory.
To enable pathogen, add to your .vimrc the following: exec ':source ' . $ALLUSERSPROFILE . '/Npackd/VimPlugins/vim-pathogen-2.3/autoload/pathogen.vim' syntax on filetype plugin indent on
Add the following to your .vimrc to enable all Vim plugins installed by Npackd: execute pathogen#infect($ALLUSERSPROFILE . '/Npackd/VimPlugins/{}')

package.name: vim-quickfixsigns
package.title: Vim plugin quickfixsigns
package.description:
Displays |signs| at interesting lines: - items in the |quickfix| and |location-lists| (e.g. compilation errors) - |marks| a-zA-Z - changes (given the file is under a VCS like git, svn, mercurial, or bazaar) - relative line numbers (show numbers only until the cursor moves) - etc.
Tags: hg

package.name: vim-restore-view
package.title: Vim plugin restore view
package.description:
automatically restore one file's cursor position and folding information after restart vim.
Minimum configuration: " restore_view " Tell vim to remember certain things when we exit " '10 : marks will be remembered for up to 10 previously edited files " "100 : will save up to 100 lines for each register " :20 : up to 20 lines of command-line history will be remembered " % : saves and restores the buffer list set viewdir=C:\\Users\\username\\vim\\viewdir set viminfo='10,\"100,:20,% set viewoptions=cursor,folds,slash,unix

package.name: vim-signify
package.title: Vim plugin Signify
package.description: uses signs to indicate added, modified and removed lines based on data of an underlying version control system. Minimum configuration in .vimrc: let g:signify_sign_delete_first_line='_'

package.name: vim-snipmate
package.title: Vim plugin snipMate
package.description: snippets

package.name: vim-supertab
package.title: Vim plugin supertab
package.description: allows you to use <Tab> for all your insert completion needs.

package.name: vim-surround
package.title: Vim plugin surround
package.description: Surround.vim is all about "surroundings": parentheses, brackets, quotes, XML tags, and more. The plugin provides mappings to easily delete, change and add such surroundings in pairs.

package.name: vim-syntastic
package.title: Vim plugin syntastic
package.description:
syntax checking plugin that runs files through external syntax checkers and displays any resulting errors to the user. This can be done on demand, or automatically as files are saved. If syntax errors are detected, the user is notified and is happy because they didn't have to compile their code or execute their script to find them.
At the time of this writing, syntax checking plugins exist for Ada, AppleScript, AsciiDoc, Bourne shell, C, C++, C#, Chef, CoffeeScript, Coco, Coq, CSS, Cucumber, CUDA, D, Dart, DocBook, Dust, Elixir, Erlang, eRuby, Fortran, Gentoo metadata, Go, Haml, Haskell, Haxe, Handlebars, HSS, HTML, Java, JavaScript, JSON, LESS, LISP, LLVM intermediate language, Lua, MATLAB, NASM, Objective-C, Objective-C++, OCaml, Perl, Perl POD, PHP, Puppet, Python, reStructuredText, Ruby, Rust, SASS/SCSS, Scala, Slim, Tcl, TeX, Twig, TypeScript, Vala, Verilog, VHDL, xHtml, XML, XSLT, YAML, z80, Zope page templates, zsh.

package.name: vim-tagbar
package.title: Vim plugin Tagbar
package.description: displays tags in a window, ordered by class etc. To enable it, add to your C:\Users\username\\.vimrc the following: let g:tagbar_ctags_bin='C:\Program Files\Exuberant_Ctags\ctags.exe'

package.name: vim-unite
package.title: Vim plugin unite.vim
package.description: search and display information from arbitrary sources like files, buffers, recently used files or registers. You can run several pre-defined actions on a target displayed in the unite window.

package.name: vim-xml
package.title: Vim plugin XML
package.description: A plugin for editing xml. The script does retain most of the functionality of the original xml.vim (http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=301) - closing tags while you type - optional adding attributes - and more - % matches end or begin tag it adds: - fold tags, comments and Cdata - add start tag - add end tags - add tag around a visual blok or a tag, - join 2 adjacent same tags - delete tag - delete tag section - change a tag - visual mode (blocks, listitems The documentation will be created once the script is loaded e.g edit a xml file. Read the help documentation by typing from within vim :help xml-plugin

package.name: vim-xmledit
package.title: Vim plugin xmledit
package.description: file type plugin to help edit XML documents. It includes tag completion and tag jumping.

package.name: vim-youcompleteme
package.title: Vim plugin youcompleteme
package.description: as-you-type, fuzzy-search code completion engine for Vim. It has several completion engines: an identifier-based engine that works with every programming language, a semantic, Clang-based engine that provides native semantic code completion for C/C++/Objective-C/Objective-C++ (from now on referred to as "the C-family languages"), a Jedi-based completion engine for Python, an OmniSharp-based completion engine for C# and an omnifunc-based completer that uses data from Vim's omnicomplete system to provide semantic completions for many other languages (Ruby, PHP etc.).

ren download_script.php VimGCWSyntax.tar.gz
set onecmd="%npackd_cl%\npackdcl.exe" "path" "--package=org.7-zip.SevenZIPA" "--versions=[9.20, 9.20]" for /f "usebackq delims=" %%x in (`%%onecmd%%`) do set sevenzipa=%%x
for /f %%x in ('dir /b *.gz') do set setup=%%x "%sevenzipa%\7za.exe" x "%setup%" > .Npackd\Output.txt && type .Npackd\Output.txt if %errorlevel% neq 0 exit /b %errorlevel% del "%setup%" if %errorlevel% neq 0 exit /b %errorlevel%
for /f %%x in ('dir /b *.tar') do set setup=%%x "%sevenzipa%\7za.exe" x "%setup%" > .Npackd\Output.txt && type .Npackd\Output.txt if %errorlevel% neq 0 exit /b %errorlevel% del "%setup%" if %errorlevel% neq 0 exit /b %errorlevel%
